summary: Melatonin is a natural substance found in many living things, discovered in 1958. It helps control our sleep-wake cycle, also known as our body clock. In vertebrates, it regulates sleep, blood pressure, and seasonal changes like reproduction and hibernation. Melatonin also acts as an antioxidant, protecting cells from damage. It's made in the mitochondria, showing its ancient origins. We can also take melatonin as a supplement or medicine to help with sleep problems.
title: Melatonin
